intro: Echeandia denticulata, commonly known as the toothed echeandia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves with a distinctive toothed margin. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in early spring. Echeandia denticulata is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to the cooler, humid climates of its native habitat.
